channel.title: Making a DVD
channel.description:
Alright. I have three files with file extensions Windows, nor I, know what to do with. However, I DO know they are supposed to go on a CD, but most likely after something (decompression/unpacking) is done to them. The files are:
MLB2K10.I00 MLB2K10.I01 MLB2K10.MDS
All help is greatly appreciated. :slight_smile:

item.title: Making a DVD
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
I00: The first file of a group of disk image files saved by DVD Shrink; designed to fit a DVD-Video disc on a single DVD-R disc; usually saved as part of a sequence of files, i.e. “.I00, .I01, .I02, etc.”

Use DVD Shrink and burn the mds file, it will ask you for several disks (in this case 2)

Read full topic

item.title: Making a DVD
item.dc:creator: higgsboson
item.description:
Something like Alcohol 120 or Magic ISO should do the job. Not sure what the I00 and I01 extensions are, I only know what MDS is but it might as well just work!

I’m convinced however that Google would point you to what you need.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a DVD

item.description:
Alright. I have three files with file extensions Windows, nor I, know what to do with. However, I DO know they are supposed to go on a CD, but most likely after something (decompression/unpacking) is done to them. The files are:
